questions.title: Two Sum (Amazon Basic)
questions.prompt: Given an array of integers and a target, return indices of two numbers that add up to the target. Assume exactly one solution.
followups: What is the time and space complexity?
What edge cases would you test?
How would you explain your approach to a teammate?

questions.title: Valid Parentheses
questions.prompt: Given a string containing parentheses/brackets/braces, determine if it is valid.
followups: Why is a stack a good fit?
What is the time and space complexity?
What inputs commonly break implementations?

questions.title: First Unique Character
questions.prompt: Given a string, return the index of the first non-repeating character. If none exists, return -1.
followups: Why is a two-pass approach common?
How do you handle Unicode?
What is the complexity?

questions.title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
questions.prompt: Given heads of two sorted linked lists, merge them and return the head of the merged list.
followups: Iterative vs recursive trade-offs?
What is the complexity?
What edge cases would you test?

questions.title: Reverse a String
questions.prompt: Reverse a string (or an array of characters) efficiently.
followups: In-place vs extra space?
What about very large strings?
What is the complexity?

questions.title: Move Zeroes
questions.prompt: Move all zeroes to the end of an array while maintaining relative order of non-zero elements (in-place).
followups: What invariant do you maintain?
How do you minimize writes?
What is the complexity?

questions.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
questions.prompt: Given daily stock prices, return the max profit from one buy and one sell. If none, return 0.
followups: Why does tracking min-so-far work?
What is the complexity?
How would it change for multiple transactions?

questions.title: Binary Search Basics
questions.prompt: Given a sorted array and a target, return the index if found; otherwise return -1.
followups: Common off-by-one pitfalls?
How do you avoid infinite loops?
What is the complexity?

questions.title: Hash Map Fundamentals
questions.prompt: Explain how a hash map works, including collisions and resizing, at a high level.
followups: Average vs worst-case complexity?
What collision strategies exist?
What makes a good hash function?

questions.title: Big-O Notation
questions.prompt: Explain Big-O notation and what it captures vs what it does not capture.
followups: Give examples of O(n), O(n log n), O(n^2).
Why can constants matter in practice?
Worst-case vs average-case?

questions.title: REST Basics
questions.prompt: What is REST and what makes an API RESTful?
followups: What is idempotency and why does it matter?
GET vs POST vs PUT vs DELETE?
What are common HTTP status codes?

questions.title: Unit Testing Basics
questions.prompt: What is unit testing? What makes a unit test valuable and maintainable?
followups: What are mocks and stubs?
How do you avoid flaky tests?
What is the difference between unit and integration tests?

questions.title: Debugging Workflow
questions.prompt: A service is failing unexpectedly. Walk through your debugging approach step-by-step.
followups: How do you narrow down the root cause?
What signals do you add (logs/metrics/traces)?
How do you prevent regression?

questions.title: Leadership Principle: Customer Obsession
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you improved something based on user/customer feedback.
followups: How did you gather the feedback?
What trade-offs did you make?
How did you measure impact?

questions.title: Leadership Principle: Ownership
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you took ownership of a problem end-to-end.
followups: What was your scope and responsibility?
How did you handle obstacles?
What would you do differently next time?

questions.title: Leadership Principle: Bias for Action
questions.prompt: Describe a time you had to move fast with incomplete information.
followups: How did you manage risk?
What did you do to validate quickly?
What was the outcome?

questions.title: Leadership Principle: Learn and Be Curious
questions.prompt: Tell me about something technical you learned quickly to deliver a result.
followups: How did you structure your learning?
How did you validate your understanding?
What did you build or improve with it?

questions.title: Leadership Principle: Dive Deep
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you investigated a tricky bug or performance issue and found the root cause.
followups: How did you reproduce the issue?
What data did you collect?
How did you prevent it from recurring?

questions.title: Why Amazon?
questions.prompt: Why do you want to intern at Amazon? Be specific about teams, products, or values that motivate you.
followups: Which leadership principle resonates most and why?
What Amazon product would you improve and how?
How do you define impact?
